summary: Jeheskiel 'Jay' Sunloy is a passionate software engineer specializing in web and mobile development. He is proficient in a wide range of technologies including TypeScript, Go, React, Next.js, and Kotlin Multiplatform. He has experience building full-stack applications, from backend services to frontend interfaces. He is a lifelong learner, constantly exploring new technologies and sharing his knowledge through his blog.

workExperience.title: Software Engineer
workExperience.description: Builds and maintains mobile and web applications. Part of the digipémad team, focusing on software development products and services. Collaborates with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality software.

workExperience.title: Software Engineer Intern
workExperience.description: Completed an intensive 7-week program on full-stack web development. Gained experience with React, Node.js, and Go. Worked on a real-world project with mentorship from experienced engineers.

workExperience.title: Developer Intern
workExperience.description: First internship experience. Built a backend for the company website using Node.js and Firebase.

education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science
education.details: GPA: 3.2. Senior project on real-time collaboration tools.

website.description: My personal portfolio website showcasing my skills, projects, and blog posts. Built with Astro + React and Tailwind CSS for optimal performance and SEO. Supports multiple languages (English and Indonesian) and features a clean, modern design. In the home page you can find sections like Hero, Experience, Skills, Projects, and Posts which can be navigated easily like '#experiences' to jump directly to the Experience section.

blogPosts.title: How I Keep My Go Code Clean (Without Going Crazy)
blogPosts.summary: Learn how to structure Go applications with clean architecture principles that actually work. Discover why pure Clean Architecture doesn't fit Go, and get a practical approach using services and repositories that keeps code maintainable without over-engineering.

blogPosts.title: How I Made My Portfolio Load Faster Than My Attention Span
blogPosts.summary: I rebuilt my portfolio website from Next.js to Astro.js and got a massive performance boost. Next.js is amazing for web applications, but for a static site like my portfolio, Astro delivers blazing-fast load times, better SEO, and a leaner codebase—while still letting me use React for interactive components.

blogPosts.title: Kotlin Multiplatform vs React Native: Which Cross-Platform Framework Should You Choose?
blogPosts.summary: Honest comparison of Kotlin Multiplatform vs React Native from a developer who has used both. Performance, DX, and real-world insights to help you choose the right cross-platform framework in 2025.

blogPosts.title: Redesigning My Portfolio: Making Space for What Matters
blogPosts.summary: A behind-the-scenes look at how I simplified my portfolio website. I went from a crowded, colorful design to a clean, minimal, and modern look that puts my work front and center. See the before & after, check out the live demos, and explore the open-source code on GitHub.

personalInterests: Reading technical tech blogs, articles, and books

openSourceContributions.contribution: Fixed some bugs found while using the library.
